bioghist.p: National Presbyterian Mariners originated in the Calvary Presbyterian Church of Wilmington, California, in 1927 under the leadership of the Reverend and Mrs. Louis H. Evans. The purpose was to bring couples into a closer relationship with their Christian faith and the church, provide meaningful social activities, and form an organized group (ship) that could be called upon to provide service and/or leadership to the church in a number of ways. Originally, Mariners was designed to be a couples' organization, but later opened membership to adult singles as well. One of the objectives of Mariners was to "interest those outside the church in uniting with the church." Individuals not formally related to the church were welcome to participate in a Mariner ship. The Mariners use a nautical theme for officers: Skippers (Presidents), First Mates (Vice Presidents), Log Keepers (Secretaries), Pursers (Treasurers), Chaplain, Cargo Masters (Work Party Chairs), and Lookouts (New Member Chairs). In 2002, the group changed its name to Presbyterian Families.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the National Mariners. Materials include: Family Ministries Commission correspondence and minutes, 1983-1985; Family Conference Commission minutes, manual, reports, and correspondence, 1983-2000; correspondence, reports, and related records documenting Marriage Enrichment/Family Nurture events, 1991-2000; Standing Committee on Nominations (SCON) manual, minutes, and correspondence, 1991-1999; National Executive Board minutes and correspondence, 1981-1999; National Advisory Council correspondence and minutes, 1960-1993; Annual Cruise/National Conference material, 1948, 1953-2003; individual membership book, 1993-1994; National Cruise registrations, 1954-1986; task force reports and minutes, 1969-1994; District files, 1983-1995; Ship files (correspondence), 1954-2001; Theme rationales, 1988-2002; Bylaws; Constitutions, 1963-1988; Charter records, 1941-2001; Incorporation paperwork, 1994-1998; annual reports, 1983-2002; IRS records, 1970; Audited financials, 1948-2002; Permanent Fund records, 1960-2005; Finance Committee minutes, 1981-1993; Dry Dock Books, 1948-1992; and manuals and handbooks, 1949-2001. Publications in the collection include: National Presbyterian Mariners Bulletin, 1943-1972; National Advisory Council (NAC) newsletter, 1960-1972; Family Ministry Advocate, 1985-1994; The National Mariner/Presbyterian Mariner/Family Patterns, 1972-2003; Windjammer, 1950-2001; Compass, 1984-2002; Presbyterian Mariner, 1980-1991; and devotional booklets and general publication, 1993-2003. The collection also includes a number of scrapbooks and Mariners-related ephemera. These materials include: Cruises scrapbook, 1939-1986 (no original records from early cruises); scrapbook (by district), circa 1975-2002; general scrapbooks containing clippings, photographs, programs and agendas, 1977-2002 (5 volumes); National Executive Secretaries' "Memory Log Book" containing biographies of NPM leaders, 1940-2004; photo albums titled "The First 25 Years" and "The Second 25 Years"; photographs, 1953; videotapes from the Los Cruses conference, 1996; audio-visual materials, 1985-1991; advertisements; pins; seals; gavel; logo masters; and a tote bag.
